To Philemon our beloved fellow worker

verse.#text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
I thank my God always when I remember you in my prayers,

#text: of the faith that you have toward the Lord Jesus and for all the saints,
and I pray that the sharing of your faith may become effective for the full
knowledge of every good thing that is in us for the sake of Christ.
For I have derived much joy and
comfort from your love, my brother, because the hearts of the saints
though I am bold enough in Christ to command you to do
yet for love's sake I prefer to appeal to you—I, Paul, an old man and now
a prisoner also for Christ Jesus—
whose father I became in my imprisonment.

verse.#text: (Formerly he was useless to you, but now he is indeed useful to you and to me.)
I am sending him back to you, sending my very heart.

#text: I would have been glad to keep him with me, in order that he might serve me
during my imprisonment for the gospel,
but I preferred to do nothing without your consent in order that your goodness might not be
by compulsion but of your own accord.
he was parted from you for a while, that you might have him back forever,
but more than a bondservant, as
a beloved brother—especially to me, but how much more to you,
both in the flesh and in the Lord.
your partner, receive him as you would receive me.

verse.#text: If he has wronged you at all, or owes you anything, charge that to my account.
I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will repay it—to say nothing of your owing me even your own self.

#text: Yes, brother, I want some benefit from you in the Lord.

verse.#text: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I say.

#text: At the same time, prepare a guest room for me, for
I will be graciously given to you.
fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends greetings to you,

verse.#text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
